text: Miloš Steigauf (born 5 December 1969 in Slaný) is a Czech javelin thrower. He has earned his living as a soldier. He finished eleventh at the 1993 World Championships with a throw of 70.78 metres. He became the last Czechoslovakian champion in javelin throw, before the country's dissolution. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing the |- |1993 |World Championships |Stuttgart, Germany |11th |70.78 m |- |1994 |European Championships |Helsinki, Finland |23rd |73.82 m |} ==External links== * Category:1969 births Category:Living people Category:Czech male javelin throwers
title: Miloš Steigauf
